group_1.textRight: But...when you say many prep schools have no@dress code,
isn't that only possible because they're schools@with lots of serious students?

group_1.textLeft: Yes, you're absolutely right.
However, it would be a different story if grades improved...
...*because* of the freedom given to the students,@wouldn't it?

group_1.textRight: Huh...?

group_1.textLeft: We have a girl from the middle school here today.

group_1.textRight: Here I am!

group_1.textLeft: Would you tell them your story?

group_1.textRight: ...Aye.
Hikaru used to be a member of the lacrosse team.
But I wanted to do something else...
I quit the club to help out with Yuna-san's@campaign.
At that time, my advisor gave me the freedom@to quit.
After that, your grades improved, right?

group_1.textLeft: Yes!
If I skipped studying as Yuna-san's supporter in the@election, it might have damaged her reputation.
Thinking that way, I naturally started to study@harder!

group_1.textRight: I am the advisor for our lacrosse team.
When I heard that Kirari was leaving the club to@help with the election,
I honestly thought it would be a waste.
However, seeing her shining like this,
I now see the importance of respecting the@students' autonomy.
Above all, having a goal in mind and working@towards it...
That is the ideal attitude for a student to have,@in my opinion.

group_1.textLeft: Currently, I think our school is pretty messy...
If we can reduce the number of problems, we'll@make money... Or something like that.
Can't you believe in us, in your students...
...just once?
If trouble increases again,
we won't mind if you reinstate the rules as they@were before.

group_1.textRight: Well, when you put it like that...
How about...we just try it out for one year?

group_1.textLeft: [chara:102201:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]Mr. Principal...?!
B-but...

group_1.textRight: I think changing the system will require a certain@amount of risk-taking.

group_1.textLeft: Indeed, that's also true.

group_1.textRight: Hm... Most staff seem to be in favor of it, but...
How do you feel about this, Parents' Association?
Would you believe in the students for once?
Please do!

group_1.textLeft: ...Please!
Well... If you're going that far, I might as well@try to believe in you.
I'm sorry that I suspected the Student Council@President was elected due to favoritism at first.
I'm sorry I doubted you.
She seems to be such a good girl, and so@considerate of her peers too.

group_1.textRight: Yeah. Her words really struck a chord with me, too.

group_1.textLeft: ...Might be worth a try, I guess, just to see how@it goes for a year.

group_1.textRight: Thank you very much.
So we'll adjust the rules about haircuts and hair@color for a year,
and if things change for the worse, we'll bring@the old rules back.
How about that, Student Council President?

group_1.textLeft: Yes, sir, I have no objection.
Thank you so much, everyone!

group_1.textRight: Oh, I was so nervous...

group_1.textLeft: Thanks for the help, Hikaru.

group_1.textRight: Anyway, it was really a head-on battle this time,@huh?

group_1.textLeft: Not by a long shot...
I've been doing charity work for a while now,
to improve my image in the eyes of the Parents'@Association...
I talked with the Principal and the advisor in@advance,
and had already reached an agreement with@most of the other teachers as well.
The meeting flowed exactly as I had planned it.

group_1.textRight: When did you...?!

group_1.textLeft: If we lost the debate, it would have been a@lost cause...
Hence the various measures we'd taken.
Nonetheless, I ensured to have done nothing@that would leave a grudge between anyone...
Through that discussion,
I think I was able to convince the Parents'@Association in a real sense...

group_1.textRight: You kind of feel like a politician, Yuna-san.

group_1.textLeft: [chara:102103:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]...?!

group_1.textRight: Ah, umm... I just mean, it's great!

group_1.textLeft: ...Oh, don't worry about it. Thanks...
(So this is how my father fought, then...)
(Dealing with mimic politics, I realized that at last.)
Hmhm... I guess it's in the blood, isn't it...
